sentence.text: Mutations in UBQLN2 have been associated with rare cases of X-linked juvenile and adult forms of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) and ALS linked to frontotemporal dementia (FTD).

Here, we report 1 known (c.1489CAAAAT, p.Pro497Ser, P497S) and 3 novel (c.1481CAAAAT, p.Pro494Leu, P494L; c.1498CAAAAT, p.Pro500Ser, P500S; and c.1516CAAAAG, p.Pro506Ala, P506A) missense mutations in the PXX domain of UBQLN2 in familial motor neuron diseases including ALS and spastic paraplegia (SP).
A novel missense mutation (c.1462GAAAAA, p.Ala488Thr, A488T) adjacent to this hotspot UBQLN2 domain was identified in a sporadic case of ALS.
